page.title: 07Our Fire-station visit.
page.content: On July 4th 1985 Robert,Michael & Mark went to visit West Cross Fire Station. First of all we waited for Robert's dad who is a fireman and he arrived at 16.05. When we got to the Fire Station we had a look at the fire engine. Rob's dad showed us all the equipment and the hoses. The biggest hose was 180 ft.long.The helmets are made out of compressed cork.After looking at the Fire Engine we went to interview the fire men. Rob's dad was 23 when he joined the fire service. The hydrants are checked nearly every day.They use a pole to force the hydrants open.After we had interviewed the firemen Robert's dad showed us around the fire station.It was great fun.They were glad we could come. by Robert Edwards,Mike Thomas & Mark Hainke.
